 - A new national strategy for HIV developed which adopts priorities and targets outlined in the Global AIDS Strategy for putting AIDS back on track in partnerships with all HIV stakeholders.

- efficiency analysis

projects.outcome: Policy and legal frameworks and institutional capacities strengthened to address gender inequality and human rights, in line with national and international commitments

projects.name: Promotion for the ratification ILO Convention on Violence and Harassment Convention, 2019 (No. 190)
projects.description: Support provided to the worker’s organizations i.e. the two trade union federations in Botswana namely; Botswana Federation of Trade Unions (BFTU), the largest of the two and the most representative federation in Botswana and Botswana Federation of Public Private Parastatal Unions (BOFEPUSU) towards the development of a campaign strategy for the ratification and the implementation of the provisions of the ILO Convention 190 on Violence and Harassment in the world of work .
projects.outcome: Policy and legal frameworks and institutional capacities strengthened to address gender inequality and human rights, in line with national and international commitments

projects.name: Economic diversification strategy implemented, strengthening exports and green growth - EID Project
projects.description: Support increment of jobs through implementation of activities from the Informal Sector Recovery Plan
projects.outcome: Botswana shifts toward a more resilient and equitable growth model that ensures economic rights and creates jobs and other economic opportunities, particularly for women and youth

projects.name: Improved technologies, practices and management systems adopted by producers in selected value chains to increase productivity, efficiency and competitiveness levels and reducing costs.
projects.description: Quality management systems for agro-processing developed and promoted to ensure that, every time a process is performed, the same information, methods, skills and controls are used and applied in a consistent manner.
projects.outcome: Food systems strengthened to improve food and nutrition security, particularly for vulnerable and marginalized groups

projects.name: Improved technologies, practices and management systems adopted by producers in selected value chains to increase productivity, efficiency and competitiveness levels and reducing costs.
projects.description: Development of Code of Good Agricultural Practice to improve the quality, safety, and sustainability of food and agricultural products while maintaining environmental, economic, and social sustainability.
projects.outcome: Food systems strengthened to improve food and nutrition security, particularly for vulnerable and marginalized groups

projects.name: The Anti-Human Trafficking Act is reviewed and amended by all concerned government organs and civil society organisations.
projects.outcome: Improved access to justice, particularly for vulnerable and marginalized groups

projects.name: Operationalize One Health platforms/approach to strengthen International Health Regulations implementation
projects.outcome: Botswana health security systems improved to detect, prevent and respond to all hazards and emergencies and fulfil duty of safety and care to people in emergencies

projects.name: Conduct simulation exercises to test Emergency Operations Centre (EOC) plans and procedures
projects.outcome: Botswana health security systems improved to detect, prevent and respond to all hazards and emergencies and fulfil duty of safety and care to people in emergencies

projects.name: Develop the National Cancer Control Plan (the cervical cancer elimination chapter)
projects.outcome: Health system, including community systems, strengthened to deliver inclusive, equitably accessible, quality integrated essential health services, inclusive of HIV and non-communicable diseases

projects.name: Support the commemoration of the priority cancer awareness days (Cervical, Prostate, Breast, Skin), including screening campaigns
projects.outcome: Health system, including community systems, strengthened to deliver inclusive, equitably accessible, quality integrated essential health services, inclusive of HIV and non-communicable diseases

projects.name: Support the Ministry of Health & Wellness to implement Stage II of the WHO Strategic Approach to improve SRHR policies and programmes
projects.description: Support improvement of SRH policies and programmes using the WHO Strategic Approach to improve SRHR policies and programmes
projects.outcome: Health system, including community systems, strengthened to deliver inclusive, equitably accessible, quality integrated essential health services, inclusive of HIV and non-communicable diseases

projects.name: Scale up implementation of Global Standards for Health Promoting Schools (GSHPS)
projects.outcome: Education system strengthened to deliver inclusive, equitably accessible, quality education

projects.name: Enhanced capacity of the National Mechanism for Reporting and Follow-up (NMRF)
projects.description: Provision of technical support to the government as duty bearer  to enhance its capacity to fulfil its obligations to, and engage with, Human Rights Mechanisms through the National Mechanism for Reporting and Follow-up (NMRF) to enhance the enjoyment of human rights by rights holders in Botswana, including groups at risk of being left behind due to discrimination and marginalisation. This will include the implementation of recommendations and the use of the national recommendations tracking data
projects.outcome: Improved efficiency, resilience and accountability of government systems

projects.name: Child responsive financial planning and reporting enhanced
projects.description: Child responsive financial planning and reporting enhanced through budget briefs (child protection, health, education), health and nutrition Public Expenditure Review (PER) and zero-based budgeting
projects.outcome: Increased availability and use of high-quality, disaggregated data by a more diverse range of stakeholders

projects.name: A gender sensitive action plan (with timeframe and responsibilities) for the prioritized international instruments and protocols is developed.
projects.outcome: Social protection system strengthened to provide equitable and efficient social protection

projects.name: Generation of disaggregrated data from national household surveys and population and housing census supported
projects.description: Generation of disaggregrated data from national household surveys and population and housing census supported
projects.outcome: Increased availability and use of high-quality, disaggregated data by a more diverse range of stakeholders

projects.name: Established and strengthened National Human Rights Institution (NHRI)
projects.description: Provision of technical support to the government as duty bearer to establish and strengthen a National Human Rights Institution in line with the recommendations of the UN human rights mechanisms, to enhance access to justice and the enjoyment of human rights for rights holders  including for marginalised groups who are subject to discrimination and at risk of being left behind
projects.outcome: Improved access to justice, particularly for vulnerable and marginalized groups

projects.name: Biodiversity and wildlife resources are managed effectively - Output 3
projects.description:
- engage the PPG team for ABS Phase 2
 - support the development of productions from natural resources (Mongongo project)
 - support MENT in undertaking a study to identify and reduce tourism leakages
 - support rollout of CBNRM manual 

2024:
 - Support implementation of BIOFIN Activities (Collate data on revenues generated from revised park fees)
 - Support development of products from natural resources (collate data on economic implications of the livelihood activities supported under KGDEP
projects.outcome: Improved capacities of communities, private sector and government to use and manage land, water and animal resources more equitably, peacefully and sustainably

projects.name: Review National Gender policy
projects.description: Strengthen coordination of GoB-UN CF Result Group on Gender Equality
projects.outcome: Strengthened multi-sectoral prevention and responses, including mechanisms for addressing harmful social norms, to achieve a progressive reduction in gender-based violence (GBV) and violence against c

projects.name: Quality assurance on the use of harmonized national monitoring and reporting
projects.description: Technical support to NAHPA  to coordinate, mentor, and provide quality assurance to districts and CSOs on the use of the harmonized national monitoring and reporting framework for AYP on HIV and SRHR
projects.outcome: Health system, including community systems, strengthened to deliver inclusive, equitably accessible, quality integrated essential health services, inclusive of HIV and non-communicable diseases

projects.name: Children at risk are supported
projects.description: Conduct a refresher course for unaccompanied and separated children (UASC) on the Bill of Rights of children enshrined in the Children’s Act of 2009; conduct sports activities for young people; purchase toys for the youth friendly space; provide psycho-social support to UASC; conduct home visits to all UASC
projects.outcome: Social protection system strengthened to provide equitable and efficient social protection

projects.name: Support State Party Annual Reporting on International Health Regulations
projects.outcome: Botswana health security systems improved to detect, prevent and respond to all hazards and emergencies and fulfil duty of safety and care to people in emergencies

projects.name: Strengthening and operationalization of the National Focal Point for International Health Regulations
projects.outcome: Botswana health security systems improved to detect, prevent and respond to all hazards and emergencies and fulfil duty of safety and care to people in emergencies

projects.name: Strengthen the National Cancer Registry by capacity building of the 4 prioritized facilities offering cancer services
projects.outcome: Health system, including community systems, strengthened to deliver inclusive, equitably accessible, quality integrated essential health services, inclusive of HIV and non-communicable diseases

projects.name: Increased effectiveness, accountability and transparency amongst institutions at all levels - Governance
projects.description:
- build capacity of officers of Governent and CSO implementing partners in the Justice Project on effectiveness and driving perfomance
 - support CSOs to establish and build capacity for a national CSO-led transparency and accountability committee to hold duty bearers
 - support DCEC to develop an investigations manual
 - support T&A committee, government, CSOs, private sector stakeholders to develop a standardised national framework for transparency  and accountability
projects.outcome: Improved efficiency, resilience and accountability of government systems

projects.name: Enhanced capacity of the Human Rights Unit in the Ministry of Justice
projects.description: Provision of technical support to government to enhance the capacity of government as duty bearer through the Human Rights Unit in the Ministry of Justice, in order to enhance the enjoyment of human rights by rights holders in Botswana, including groups at risk of being left behind due to marginalisation and discrimination.
projects.outcome: Improved efficiency, resilience and accountability of government systems

projects.name: Enhanced capacity of CSOs and UNCT to engage with Human Rights Mechanisms
projects.description: The capacity of civil society organisations, including rights holders at risk of being left behind due to discrimination and marginalisation, and the UNCT to engage with Human Rights Mechanisms will be enhanced to promote greater enjoyment of human rights.
projects.outcome: Improved access to justice, particularly for vulnerable and marginalized groups

projects.name: Food safety and hygiene enhanced through implementation of strategies and programmes for effective food control systems and monitoring of chemical residues and other food contaminants.
projects.description: To develop a National Food Safety Strategy
projects.outcome: Botswana health security systems improved to detect, prevent and respond to all hazards and emergencies and fulfil duty of safety and care to people in emergencies

projects.name: Enhanced enjoyment of human rights by persons with disabilities in Botswana
projects.description: Provide technical support and capacity building to OPDs, CSOs, the Ombudsman and government in Botswana regarding the implementation of the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities to enhance the capacity of persons with disabilities, as rights holders subject to discrimination, to claim their rights and of duty bearers to discharge their obligations, as well as support the implementation of the UNPRPD Tier 2B project in Botswana  through facilitation of the induction training,  wit
projects.outcome: Improved access to justice, particularly for vulnerable and marginalized groups

projects.name: Disposal of PCB oils contained in transformers and disposal of capacitors containing PCB in Southern Africa
projects.description: To reduce environmental and human health risks from PCB releases through demonstration of a regional approach to the introduction of cost-effective and socially acceptable environmentally sound management (ESM) of PCB oils, equipment and waste held by electrical utilities and other PCB owners in participating countries.
projects.outcome: Improved capacities of communities, private sector and government to use and manage land, water and animal resources more equitably, peacefully and sustainably

projects.name: Public awareness raised to prevent and respond to Violence Against Children
projects.description: Nationwide campaign on raising public awareness to prevent and respond to Violence Against Children.
projects.outcome: Strengthened multi-sectoral prevention and responses, including mechanisms for addressing harmful social norms, to achieve a progressive reduction in gender-based violence (GBV) and violence against c

projects.name: Strengthening of budget openness practices and public participation
projects.description: Strengthening of budget openness practices and public participation
projects.outcome: Increased availability and use of high-quality, disaggregated data by a more diverse range of stakeholders

projects.name: Capacities strengthened for sustainable use and management of natural resources
projects.description: To reconcile issues of food security and wildlife conservation through the sustainable and legal exploitation of wild animal populations by rural stakeholders and an adjustment of the supply of alternative proteins of domestic origin for the benefit of rural and urban populations.
projects.outcome: Improved capacities of communities, private sector and government to use and manage land, water and animal resources more equitably, peacefully and sustainably
